intro: Bergia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian bergia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming during the dry season. Bergia abyssinica has a compact, mat-forming growth habit, with fleshy, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
